THE CORPORATION OF THE CITY OF BELLEVILLE
BY-LAW NUMBER 2006-140
A BY-LAW TO LICENCE, REGULATE AND GOVERN CERTAIN BUSINESSES

WHEREAS pursuant to Part IV, Section 150(1) of the Municipal Act, S.O.
2001, C.25 as amended, (“The Act’), the Council of The Corporation of the City
of Belleville has the authority to licence, regulate and govern any business wholly
or partly carried on within the municipality even if the business is being carried on
from a location outside the municipality which authority includes the power to
impose conditions on the obtaining, holding or removing of a licence;

AND WHEREAS, pursuant to Section 150(2) of The Act, except as
otherwise provided, a municipality may only exercise its licensing powers under
Section 150, including imposing conditions for one or more of the following
purposes:

Health and Safety
Nuisance Control
Consumer Protection

AND WHEREAS Section 150(4) of The Act, provides that before passing
a by-law under Section 150, the council of the municipality shall except in the
case of emergency, hold at least one public meeting at which any person who
attends has an opportunity to make representation with respect to the matter;
and ensure that notice of the public meeting is given;

AND WHEREAS such meeting was held on the 17" day of July
2006 in the City of Belleville;

AND WHEREAS, pursuant to the City of Belleville Notice By-law 2002-178
notice of such meeting was provided in the newspaper, namely the Belleville
Intelligencer, on July 8", 2006;

NOW, THEREFORE, THE COUNCIL OF THE CORPORATION OF THE CITY
OF BELLEVILLE ENACTS AS FOLLOWS:

1.0 FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS BY-LAW:

1.1 “Appeals Committee” means the Planning Advisory Committee
duly appointed by by-law.

1.2 “Application” means an application for a new business licence or to
renew a business licence, which is submitted to the Licensing
Officer pursuant to this by-law.

“Automotive Service Station” means a building or place where
gasoline, oil, grease, antifreeze, tires, tubes, tire accessories,
electric light bulbs, spark-plugs and batteries for motor vehicles are
stored or kept for sale, or where motor vehicles may be oiled,
greased or have their ignitions adjusted, tires inflated or batteries
charged, or where only minor or running repairs essential to the
actual operation of motor vehicles are executed or performed.

“Bed and Breakfast/Lodging House” means a single detached
dwelling in which the owner or operator who occupies the dwelling
provides a maximum of three (3) rooms for the temporary
accommodation of the traveling public and may provide meals to
overnight guests.

“City” means the Corporation of the City of Belleville;

“Council” means the Council of the Corporation of the City of
Belleville.

“Downtown Business Improvement Area” means the geographic
area designated by By-Law No. 9275 as amended from time to time
or in a successor to that by-law.

“Driving Instructor’? means any person who teaches persons to
operate motor vehicles and receives compensation therefore.

“Driving School’ means any building, structure, institution or other
place which offers to provide or does provide instruction for
compensation in the operating of motor vehicles.

“Driving School Operator’ means any person who owns, operates
or has care and control of a driving school.

“Hawker/Pediar’ means:

(a) any person who goes from place to place, or to a particular
place, with goods, wares or merchandise for sale, or who
carries and displays samples, patterns or specimens of any
goods, wares or merchandise for which orders are taken and
that are to be delivered in the City simultaneously or afterwards,

(b) any retailer which has an employee or agent who goes from
place to place or to a particular place with goods, wares or
merchandise for sale, or who carries and displays samples,
patterns or specimens of any goods, wares or merchandise for
which orders are taken and that are to be delivered in the City
simultaneously or afterwards.

“Highway” means the same definition as set out in the Highway
Traffic Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. H. 8, as amended from time to time or
any successor thereof.

“Hobby” means a pursuit, recreation, object, plan, craft, or art,
which is performed for pleasure and without profit or for minimal
profit.

“Hobby Association” means a formal or informal group of people
who share the same, or a similar hobby.

“Hobby Show” means an event at which goods, wares or
merchandise are exhibited, exchanged or sold between members
of a non-profit Hobby Association and the public for the
advancement of the hobby.

“Hotel” means a separate building or two or more connected
buildings used mainly for the purpose of catering to the needs of
the travelling public by the supply of food and also by the furnishing
of sleeping accommodation of not fewer than six bedrooms as
distinguished from any other building or connected buildings used
mainly for the purpose of supplying food and lodging by the week or
otherwise commonly known as “boarding house” or of furnishing
living quarters for families and having a dining room or restaurant
commonly known as “apartment houses” or “private hotels”.

“Licence” means the certificate or document issued pursuant to this
by-law as proof of licensing under this by-law.

“Licensee” means a person who holds a licence under this by-law,
and “licensed” and “licensed business” has a corresponding
meaning.

“Licensing Officer’ means in all cases, except in regards to a
plumber’s business licence, anyone appointed by the City of
Belleville as a Licensing Officer and anyone the Licensing Officer
may delegate the performance of his or her functions to under this
by-law from time to time as the occasion requires. In regard to an
application for a Plumber's Business Licence, the Chief Building
Official or his or her designate shall be the Licensing Officer.

“Motel” means an establishment that provides lodging for motorists
in rooms usually having direct access to an open parking area.
Also called motor court, motor lodge.

“Motor Vehicle” means an automobile, motorcycle, motor assisted
bicycle unless otherwise indicated in the Highway Traffic Act,
R.S.0, 1990, c. H.8. and any other vehicle propelled or driven

“Municipality” means the area included within the corporate limits of

“Non-Resident” means a person who does not reside or have a

“Person” means a person as defined in the Interpretation Act,

“Place of Business” means any place, premises or location, or part

store or office in a dwelling unit which is accessible to the public
and, where there is no such place, premises or location from which
the business is carried on, it includes a vehicle or other equipment

“Property Standards By-Law” means a by-law enacted under

which prescribes standards for the maintenance and occupancy of

or

e an automobile service station

“Public Hall” means a building or structure or part thereof including
a banquet hail or a portable building or tent, offered for the use as a
place of public assembly.

“Regular Place of Business” means the piace where a business is
conducted in the normal or ordinary course of business and does
not include a place, premises or location in which a business is
conducted temporarily or on a one-time basis.

“Resident” means a person who resides or has a regular place of
business in the City of Belleville.

“Resort”? means a place frequented by people for relaxation or
recreation.

“Special Sale’ means an event at which goods, wares or
merchandise are exhibited by members of a not for profit
association, consisting of several participating exhibitors which
include persons who do not pay business taxes to the City of
Belleville.

APPLICATION OF BY-LAW

2.1

2.2

The requirements of this by-law apply to the businesses carried on
within the geographic limits of Municipality as identified on
Appendix “1” and attached to this by-law, and further business(es)
types that the City may designate.

The requirement to obtain a licence applies to every business
described in section 2.1 regardless of whether the business is
being carried on wholly or partly within the Municipality. It shall be
deemed to be carried on within the Municipality even if the business
is being carried on from a location outside the Municipality.

LICENCE REQUIRED

3.1

3.2

3.3

No person shall carry on or operate within the Municipality any
trade, calling, business, or occupation set out in Appendix “1” of this
by-law unless they have obtained a licence issued by the City
pursuant to this by-law.

A person shall carry on business only in the name in which the
business is licensed.

A licence shall be required for each separate business and each
separate place of business.

A business licence shall only be in effect for a 12 month period
commencing on July 1* and expiring on June 30".

A licensee shall renew their licence no later than July 1° of each
year.

A licence issued after July 1* shall expire on the first June 30"
following the date of issue.

For a new licence, the full licence fee as set out in the applicable
schedule to this by-law will be reduced by 25 percent if the
completed licence application is submitted between January 1° and
June 30",

Every licence, at all times, is owned by and is the property of the
licensee and is valid only in respect of the person and the premises
or of the person named therein and for the nature of business
stated in the licence and no licence may be transferred, sold,
purchased, leased, morigaged, charged, encumbered, assigned,
pledged, seized, distained or otherwise dealt with.

A licence shall be deemed to be cancelled immediately upon
change of ownership or location of the business, or upon
discontinuation of the business.

No person holding a licence issued pursuant to this by-law shall fail

to,

(a) With respect to the premises, display the licence in a
conspicuous place in or on the said premises; or

(b) With respect to a vehicle, display the licence in a conspicuous
place in or on the said vehicle; or

(c) With respect to an individual, maintain the licence on their
person while conducting the activity for which the licence was
issued; or

(d) Produce the licence upon request by an authorized employee or
agent of the City or

(e) Produce photo identification upon request by an authorized

employee or agent of the City for the purpose of confirming that

the carrier of the licence is the person to whom the licence was

issued.

Every licensee shall allow an authorized employee or agent of

the City to inspect his or her place of business to determine

whether the provisions of this by-law are being complied with,

and no person shall obstruct, hinder or otherwise interfere with

such an inspection.

Notwithstanding any other provision of this by-law the Licensing
Officer may issue a Licence or may renew a Licence subject to
such special terms and conditions as are necessary to give effect to
this by-law and the attached Schedules, or as are agreed to by the
licence applicant.

The requirement of obtaining a licence under this by-law is in
addition to, and not in substitution for, any other legislation to obtain
a licence or licences or other regulatory approval under any other
federal, provincial or municipal legislation.

No person licensed under this by-law shall discriminate in the
carrying on of the business because of race, ancestry, place of
origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual
orientation, age, marital status, family status or disability.

No licensee shall refuse to permit an animal, while serving as a
guide or a leader for a disabled person to enter and remain on his
or her premises used for the business.

Every licensee shall notify the Licensing Officer within 4 days, or
within such other time as the Licensing Officer may permit, of any
changes to information contained in the application.

Any business licence fees are non-refundable if the application is
refused for any reason or is withdrawn by the applicant prior to the
issuance of a licence.

Any business licence application which has not received approvals
from all municipal or provincial departments or agencies as the
Licensing Officer deems necessary within 90 days or such further
time as the Licensing Officer may permit, from the date of the filing
of the application, because of the applicant’s inability to comply with
the requirements to become licensed, shall be deemed to have
expired unless the Licensing Officer allows otherwise.

In accordance with the Municipal Act (The Act), in addition to the
full licence fee as set out in the applicable schedule to this by-law,
the City has the power to require the payment, by a licensed
business, of additional fees at any time during the term of the
licence for costs incurred by the City attributable to the activities of
the business.

ADMINISTRATION

By-law Number 2006-140 Page 8

5.1

5.2

The administration of this by-law is assigned to the Licensing
Officer who may delegate the performance of his or her functions
under this by-law from time to time as required,

Every application for a new licence or a renewal or extension of an
existing licence shall be submitted on the forms provided by the
City. The Licensing Officer has the right to amend the form as
needed.

The Licensing Officer shall maintain complete records showing all
applications received and licences issued.

The Licensing Officer shall stamp each application with the date
and time of the receipt of the application and each application shall
be processed in the order in which it is received subject to the
provision in 5.5 below.

The applications will be processed giving priority to applications for
renewal of licences for the 12 month period as referred to in section
4.1 provided the application for renewal is received by the
Licensing Officer on or before June 30".

Every application will be subject to investigations and approvals
from such municipal or provincial departments or agencies as the
Licensing Officer deems necessary, or as directed by Council,
including but not limited to: City of Belleville Licensing Department,
Planning and Zoning Department, Fire Department, Belleville Police
Service, Conservation Authority, Hastings and Prince Edward
Counties Health Unit, Parks and Recreation Department, Building
Department, and/or such other agencies or departments as the City
and/or Licensing Officer deems necessary.

No individual shall be licensed or act as a representative of the
licensee under this by-law unless the individual is eighteen (18)
years of age or over.

Every application for a new licence or a renewal or extension of a
licence shall as a minimum be accompanied by:

(a) The full licence fee as set out in the applicable schedule to this
by-law;

(b) Proof of age, if requested by the Licensing Officer;

(c) Any information requested in the applicable schedule to this by-
law;

(d) If operating under a business name, a current Business Names
Report certified by the Ministry of Consumer and Business
Services;

(e) If operating as a partnership, a copy of the registered
declaration of partnership;

(f) If operating as a corporation, a current Corporation Profile
Report certified by the Ministry of Consumer and Business
Services.

Where two or more persons carry on or engage in a partnership
requiring a licence under this by-law, the licence will be issued in
the name of each partner, and the name and address of each
member of the partnership shall be set out in the application.

The Licensing Officer shall not process an Application unless all
licensing fees, fines, court costs or other outstanding fees arising
from this by-law or a predecessor of this by-law in relation to the
business being licensed, are paid in full.

SCHEDULES

6.1

6.2

Appendix “1” and the schedules referred to therein are attached to
and form part of this by-law.

Every Licensee shall comply with this by-law and the applicable
schedules and conditions which relate to the licence issued.

REFUSAL TO ISSUE OR RENEW A LICENCE

7.4

The Licensing Officer may refuse to issue or renew a Licence:

(a) Where the conduct of any Person, including the conduct of any

officer, director, employee or agent of a Corporation affords

reasonable cause to believe that the person will not carry on or

engage in the business in accordance with the law or with

honesty and integrity;

Where the issuance of the Licence or renewal of the Licence

would be contrary to the public interest relating to Health &

Safety, Nuisance and Consumer Protection;

(c) Where the fees due in respect of such Licence as set out in this
by-law have not been paid in full;

(d) Where any fines, judgements or costs to the City or the Court
due in respect of this by-law have not been paid in full

(e) Where the Application or any documents required under this
by-law have not been complete or have been completed
incorrectly or have not been provided to the Licensing Officer;

(f) Where the Applicant or Licensee is carrying on an activity that
is, or will be, if the Applicant is licensed, in contravention of this
by-law or any other law, or statute;

(h) Upon such other grounds as are set out in this by-law;

NON-COMPLIANCE WITH BY-LAW

8.1

8.2

lf, at any time, the Licensing Officer determines as a result of
evidence that is provided, that the operation of a licensed business
does not comply with the requirements of this by-law, the Licensing
Officer shall issue an “Order to Comply” by ordinary mail to the
Licensee or the last known address noted in the application for
licence.

If a licensee has not complied with the Order to Comply within 15
days after the date of mailing the Order to Comply, the Licensing
Officer may suspend or revoke the licence by mailing a Notice of
Suspension or Revocation by ordinary mail.

NOTICE OF REFUSAL

9.1

In the event that the Licensing Officer does not issue the licence,
the Licensing Officer shall notify the applicant of the decision by
sending a Notice of Refusal by ordinary mail to the applicant at the
address noted in the application for licence.

SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION OF A LICENCE

10.1

10.2

10.3

Every Licence issued under this by-law may be revoked or
suspended if there are reasonable grounds to believe false
information has been provided in the application or if any part
of this by-law is contravened.

The Licensing Officer may suspend or revoke for cause any licence
issued under this by-law if any of the provisions of this by-law are
contravened.

No licence shall be issued to any person in respect of any premises
in which the carrying on or operation of the business for which the
application is being made is in contravention of any by-law of the
City or any applicable provincial or federai legislation.

10.4 Any licence may be revoked or suspended if the person is in
contravention of any by-law of the City or any applicable provincial
or federal legislation.

APPEALS PROCEDURE

11.1. A person whose application for a new licence or a renewal of a
licence has been refused or a person whose licence has been
suspended or revoked may apply within 15 days of the date of
mailing the Notice of Refusal, Suspension, or Revocation to the
Appeals Committee for a review of the decision and will be given an
opportunity to make written representation to or appear before the
Appeals Committee.

11.2 The Appeals Committee may by a simple majority confirm the
decision of the Licensing Officer or may direct the Licensing Officer
to issue, renew or reinstall the licence, andthe decision of the
Appeals Committee is final.

ENFORCEMENT OF THIS BY-LAW

12.1 The enforcement of this by-law is assigned to the Belleville Police
Service, and to the Licensing Officer and his or her delegates.

OFFENCE AND PENALTY PROVISIONS

13.1 Every person who contravenes any provision of this by-law,
including any Schedule hereto, is guilty of an offence, and upon
conviction, is liable to a fine as provided in the Provincial Offences
Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. P.33 for each offence and such fine shall be
recoverable under the Provincial Offences Act, R.S.O. 1990, c.
P.33 .

SEVERABILITY

14.1. Should any section, clause or provision of this by-law be held by a
Court of competent jurisdiction to be ultra vires or invalid, the
validity of the remainder of the by-law shall not be affected and the
said, section, clause or provision shall be severable from the
remainder of the by-law.

EFFECTIVE DATE AND TRANSITION

By-law Number 2006-140 Page 12

15.1 By-Law Nos. 13138 and 13795 as amended and any and all by-
laws or portions thereof or resolutions of Council or the Council of
the former Township of Thurlow contrary hereto or inconsistent
herewith shall be and are hereby repealed.

15.2 Reference in any document to a by-law repealed by this by-law
shall be deemed to be reference to this by-law

15.3 This by-law shall come into effect upon the final passing hereof.

16.0 EXPIRY

16.1 This by-law expires five (5) years after it comes into force or the
day it is repealed.

17.0 SHORT TITLE

17.1 This by-law may be referred to as the Business Licensing By-Law.

SCHEDULE A

AUCTIONEERS

Any person selling or putting up for sale goods, wares, merchandise or effects by

public auction.

The requirement to obtain an "auctioneer licence” does not apply to:

a person conducting an auction on behalf of a service club or similar organization to raise
money for charitable purposes;

a sheriff or court bailiff acting under a court procedure;

a municipality conducting an auction under the tax sale provisions of the Municipal Act;
Such other circumstances as the Licensing Officer may deem appropriate for exemption.

In addition to the General Regulations set out in this by-law the following special conditions
apply

Every auctioneer shall be recommended by at least two residents of the municipality whose
testimonials shall be embodied in the application for license.

No auctioneer licensed under this By-Law shall sell or put up for sale by public auction any
jewellery except in accordance with the following regulations:

The auctioneer shall before the sale or putting up for sale of such jewellery, obtain from the
owner a list showing all such jewellery to be sold, together with the average retail price of each
article during the preceding twelve months.

All such auction sales of jewellery shall be held on consecutive business days until all the
jewellery included in the list has been sold, provided, however, that no sale shall exceed fifteen
consecutive business days.

The auctioneer shall not sell or put up for sale by public auction any jewellery except for a
person who has conducted a jewellery business in one location within the limits of the City of
Belleville, for at least one year next preceding the date of the sale.

The auctioneer shall keep and retain the list of jewellery to be sold and a list of the jewellery sold
each day for a period of at least fifteen (15) days following the termination of the sale and shall
produce any such lists to the Chief of Police for the municipality if and when requested.

The auction shall be held only on the business premises of the owner thereof or at such other
premises as the Issuer of Licenses, or other person authorized by Council may approve.

For the purposes of this Section "jewellery" shall include watches, clocks, precious

stones, silverware, articles of value used for adornment of the person and costly ornaments.
Special Conditions (1), (2), (3), (4), (5), (6), (7) and (8) shall not, however, apply to an
auctioneer licensed hereunder who is selling the chattels and effects of an estate, part of
Which consists of jewellery, if said jewellery is duly described in the catalogue of articles to be
auctioned.
